Press Releases.Title: 61 New Cases of Locally Transmitted Covid-19 Infection
Press Releases.MainContent:
1.     As of 11 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 61 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 33 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 11 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 17 are currently unlinked. Amongst the cases are 3 seniors above 70 years who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, and are at risk of serious illness.

2.     In addition, there are 2 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. Both were detected upon arrival in Singapore.

3.     In total, there are 63 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.

4.     We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.

MINISTRY OF HEALTH

11 AUGUST 2021
